ResponsesInList.Title: Set up a search-box (textfield/html) to search content within a specific course?
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm trying to implement a search-box into a moolde course with a lot of content. Of course you can use the global search and set a filter to the specific course. But I'd rather place a search-box directly in this course for better UX. Can anyone help setting up such a search-box (eg. using textfield/html)? Maybe even post a html code snippet? I'm looking basically for global search box with a predefined filter to a certain course . I know how to set a global search box within a course using textfield/html - what I haven't achieved so far, is presetting a filter to the course within the global search. Is there a way to preset filters directly in the URL (global search: https://xxxx.com/search/index.php)? Thanks for your help!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Set up a search-box (textfield/html) to search content within a specific course?
ResponsesInList.Text: We found a solution for this problem - you can add a label with a search box, that searches only within a certain course, using the follwoing html code: <form class="search-input-form expanded" action="https:// YOURMOODLEURL /search/index.php"><label for="id_q_ XXXXX " class="accesshide">Search</label><input type="text" filter="course: coursename " name="q" placeholder="Search" size="13" tabindex="-1" id="id_q_ XXXXX " class="form-control"> <input type="hidden" name=" context " value="2"> <input type="hidden" name="courseids" value=" insert id-number of course "> </form>

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Set up a search-box (textfield/html) to search content within a specific course?
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a great idea, especially for courses with a lot of material. I have published a Generico filter that you can use to insert this HTML fragment into any course, see Re: Generico Showcase (in-course search box) for details.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Set up a search-box (textfield/html) to search content within a specific course?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Accessibility Features:  Adding Audio Description

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Accessibility Features:  Adding Audio Description
ResponsesInList.Text: And I guess that used to be adequate when the feature was first developed. Since then, the accessibility feature in video called 'Audio Description' has entered our main stream media world, where a voice-over basically describes what's happening in a video for visually impaired users, much in the same way as you'd use captions / subtitles for hearing impaired users.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keyboard Access/Screen Reader text on Interactive Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: "the CC is not displayed in the screen reader " Is that a reference to Closed Captions? I cannot help with an answer, but people who might be able to help would need this sort of information. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keyboard Access/Screen Reader text on Interactive Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Marcus - CC = Closed Captioning. What I meant by keyboard accessibility,  screen reader users use the tab key to access content like a Quiz and select a radio button or checkbox, this ability is lost in the course. The Closed Captioning which is displayed on the screen, should also be displayed as part of the screen reader text for when users with assistive technology use a course, but is not always displayed. These are the issues, I am trying to resolve. Hopefully, someone has had the same issues and can provide an answer. Thanks for your time.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keyboard Access/Screen Reader text on Interactive Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Can you check the javascript console to see id any errors are shown and paste them here. https://linuxhint.com/javascript-console What is the difference between the tabbing order as it should be and as it is now. Do you have a small example you can post here for other people to test?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keyboard Access/Screen Reader text on Interactive Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Screen readers have difficulty accessing content in iframes. The SCORM activity has an option to control how the material displays. Under Appearance heading you can select whether content displays in same window or in a separate window. When displaying in the same window the content is actually displayed embedded in an iframe with Moodle headers and blocks. Opening in new window opens a new window without the inframe or extra content that is more accessible, but may be less convenient for other reasons.

ResponsesInList.Title: Changing headers in list of users

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Changing headers in list of users
ResponsesInList.Text: Marc, Only by changing the code, unfortunately. The setting "Default user filters" only affects the filters, not the columns. And the settings for "Show user identity" and "Hide user fields" do not apply to the Browse list of users, only to things such as the Participants list, etc. This would be a nice feature to have. Perhaps in Moodle 4.0, the new Report Builder will be able to do this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Changing headers in list of users

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Changing headers in list of users
ResponsesInList.Text: In Workplace you can make a custom report with the user list with specific user fields you want, including a link to the user profile. It is not exactly the same as Browse list of users, but close. Hopefully this will be available in the Report Builder in Moodle 4.0. That would certainly help you do what you want even if there are no changes to Browse list of users itself.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Changing headers in list of users
ResponsesInList.Text: If 'Show user identity' does not apply to 'Browse list of users', then that is a bug, or at least a missing feature. If there is not already a tracker issue for that, someone should make one. The someone should make a patch.

The only method I can think of right now is to painstakingly copy and paste raw text from the subtitles file into my course page, but that's impractical especially for longer videos. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to get nicely-formatted YouTube video transcripts?
ResponsesInList.Text: How to create and download a transcription for your YouTube video with VEED In a nutshell, VEED is an online video editor that lets you automatically generate captions for your videos. Here’s how you can create and download a transcript for your YouTube video. ‍The video editor lets you upload a file directly from your computer or by posting a YouTube link. If you have the video downloaded or ready on your computer, you can click My Device and upload it there. Otherwise, copy-pasting the YouTube video URL works just as well.

ResponsesInList.Title: Participants filter
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle 3.9 includes a new filter design on the Participants page. This is quite powerful and I can see some benefits for it when filtering by multiple characteristics. For simple filtering though, it adds a lot more clicking to achieve a result. Our most common use for a filter on the participants page is to identify students in the course. This was achieved with two clicks in 3.8 by selecting the filter drop down and then choosing 'Student'. In 3.9 this requires five clicks to achieve - Select the data filter field, select the 'Roles' data type, select the Roles input field, select Student, select Apply filters. It would be good to be able to set defaults for this filter so that a commonly used search was quickly available to users. For our site this would be Role/Students so a teacher wanting to just see the students in their course would only have to select Apply Filters. If they want any other search then they would go through the process as normal. I haven't been able to find any settings for this in Site Administration. Should I be able to set site defaults? Does this seem like a reasonable request?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Participants filter
ResponsesInList.Text: I also believe a default participants filter would be extremely useful and if anyone knows an answer to this I'd be interested as well

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Participants filter
ResponsesInList.Text: This reminds me about the same discussion that we have had about activities . It is about the trade-off between more "power" and "simpler." Moodle "activities" (e.g., quiz, forum) are very powerful and flexible. Along with this flexibility, there are many items that can be adjusted. What has been requested are "templates" that could be configured that capture your most favorite settings, and then can be applied as needed. So, we see the same thing with the Participants Filter. We now have a lot of power and flexibility, but it takes a little more to get everything set. It would be nice to have "templates" where one should set up their most favorite filtering criteria. I would like to see both. But until we have templates, I still favor having more features so that I can get to what I want to have.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Participants filter
ResponsesInList.Text: Our campus could make use of the default participant list filter as well, although having one we could configure as admins would be sufficient. I have submitted an issue on Tracker: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-72763 .

ResponsesInList.Title: moodle 3.5 : course overview: why completed courses are shown in in progress tab
ResponsesInList.Text: In course overview block, why the "in progress" tab shows 100% completed courses? Completed courses are not moved to "Past" tab.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle 3.5 : course overview: why completed courses are shown in in progress tab
ResponsesInList.Text: Those tabs depend on the course chronological settings and not on the completed progress of each student

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle 3.5 : course overview: why completed courses are shown in in progress tab
ResponsesInList.Text: But as per moodle 3.5 doc "For courses to appear in the 'In Progress' section, they must be not yet completed and the current date must be after the course start date. The current date must be before the end date, or there is no end date". https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/Course_overview

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle 3.5 : course overview: why completed courses are shown in in progress tab
ResponsesInList.Text: It also depends how frequently your Cron jobs run - the Cron job execution moves the 100% completed courses to the Past tab. Completion marks as started Calculate regular completion data

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle 3.5 : course overview: why completed courses are shown in in progress tab
ResponsesInList.Text: both jobs completed succesfully and no errors shown. But still 100% completed courses are in "in progress tab".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle 3.5 : course overview: why completed courses are shown in in progress tab
ResponsesInList.Text: I found the root cause for this as there were no completion criteria set for the courses. So to move 100% completed courses to "past" tab the criteria is as below. 1. set activity completion 2. set completion criteria for the course (course administration-> course completion) 3.Run the cron job -Completion marks as started -Calculate regular completion data

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restriction information on mouseover
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all again, with the power of Google (which substituted PHP and CSS skills) I came up with a first solution. First I tried to solve it only with custom CSS because it could be implemented in a site easier than hacking some of the php files. I was able to get get a field that will be truncated if there are more than 3 rows and turn into a scrollable field. I used code from Handling Short And Long Content In CSS - Ahmad Shadeed (ishadeed.com) . But then the list items started to overlap and a scrollbar is less pretty than a spoiler (or even mouse over). But I realy like the <details> tag. I thought it will be much easier than hacking a CSS spoiler class. So I tackled the availability_info.mustace and added a <details> block there. Of course this first got attached to any restriction message. To apply it only when there (possibly many) restrictions I altered the renderer.php as well to check for a list element in the info text. This is the result: What files I edited: lib\templates\availability_info.mustache course\renderer.php What did not work: adding a <details> block with ::before CSS because only plain text can be added checking if an class contains a list element (<ul>) because the :has() statement from CSS4 is not implemented in browsers yet creating and editing the availability_info.mustache in the boost theme folder editing the course\format\renderer.php Untried ideas: writing a CSS spoiler class and counting the rows of the box and toggle the visibility state of the element depending on its length (this way I we might don't have to touch the renderer.php) creating a child theme from boost and hopefully use a local availability_info.mustache Possible improvements deeper in the system: having a checkbox in the activity "Restrict access" area to toggle the usage of the <details> block manually instead of using it on all lists (no matter how long) Making the "Click for details." text responsive to other language settings. This solution has not be checked if it will work in the mobile app as well. Best regards, Simon

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doubt about different Moodle languages
ResponsesInList.Text:
No, Moodle does not differ from one language to another. It is the same software no matter what language the site or course or user may be using. The function remains the same whichever language it may be shown in. All the standard "strings" included with Moodle which show buttons, navigation, menus, settings, help, and so forth can be changed from one language to another at several levels using "Language packs". They can be further customised on your site, as well. Please see the documentation on Language for the details. Any
content you add to a Moodle site will be in whatever language the content is written or made with. Moodle does not translate or otherwise change the language of content you add.
Moodle's language packs only change the wording for the standard
navigation and other included features. If you have more questions about how the languages work in Moodle, including running a Moodle site using multiple language, then please take a look at the documentation pages and also the Languages forum for support . This site is a support site about Moodle, which has communities in several languages. The forums on this site dedicated to certain languages are simply forums created for users to speak with one another in a particular language. The "Moodle in English" forums, including this one, are for use in English. If you want to get support, ask or answer questions, or chat with people in another language on this site, you can join one of the forums specifically for speakers of that language.

ResponsesInList.Title: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: Currently, our Moodle platform is only available on our corporate intranet and we are working towards an online publication that will have the following features: 1. Diversified access for internal and external users 2. Full access to all courses for internal users (as usual) 3. Access to only part of the courses for external users The last point is the one we can't develop. Has anyone had this kind of need before? If yes, how did you implement it? Thanks Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi The difference between internal and external users needs a clarification. Do you mean when somebody logs in from the LAN, usually from private IP addresses like 10.x.x.x, he is internal and if the address is from the Internet he is external? Or, people who are attached to your institution, usually the e-mail belongs to your domain or authenticated by your LDAP are internal and all the others external?

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Visvanath Internal: access via web with LDAP and two-factor authentication with access to all content. External: they will not be able to register via web (they will always be enrolled manually) and will access with Moodle login + 2-factor authentication (Google auth): they should access viewing only courses defined / categorized for external (e.g. creating a category or more). The goal is to diversify access to courses... but I know Moodle was not designed for this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi OK. Unless I am not missing something there is a simple answer. Internal: Keep the current authentication and enrollment procedure.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, the main problem is that it's a matter of managing the "course access split" at the authentication level, not at the course enrollment level. In fact, there is no guest access but authentication is always required. In the platform there are several courses with different methods of enrollment and some of these courses (regardless of the method of enrollment) should not be "visible" to external users, but only to internal ones. While those who authenticate manually (external) should only be able to see a defined set of courses. The web publication would then provide accessible courses, divided as follows: 1) Only to internal users 2) Internal and external users 3) External only A simple solution would be to use two different platforms, but it would become challenging to manage the content...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Ri: Re: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: OK. There is some logic, which I can't grab. It goes in circles around site-wide (authentication) and course-wide (authorization), visibility (externals not even seeing the names of the h courses), activity-level (seeing/participation control). No sorry, I have no idea. Still believe that the subject is enrollment. May be people there can help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Diversify access and viewing of courses for registered users (internal and external)
ResponsesInList.Text: At the moment, we have decided to publish Moodle on the web with accessibility only to our collaborators. The need to have different access to courses, for example based on a particular student profile, does not seem to be an easy solution to manage, also in light of what has emerged in this discussion: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=325615 We'll revisit the analysis later. In the meantime, if there are similar needs that have already been resolved, we would be happy to hear about them. Thank you

But when what is in the editor is actually submitted to be published on Moodle, these pasted images are lost. Students only realise this after their classmates or teachers start posting questions such as "which screenshot are you reffering to?" ResponsesInList.Title: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am using MOODLE 3.9 Is there a way to create a master activity and then make that master activity available / viewable in other courses? For example I create a label which explains 'some in house admin process'. I want the label to show in the following courses so I select it to be visible in the following Art Maths Music plus five more Our in house processes change and I need to update the label. I change the master label and all the other visable instances of it are automatically updated. Is there anything which does this? Many thanks Marie

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Marie, I can suggest two possibilities: the course metalink . You create a course that contains this resource that you want to share through different courses. In this course, you add the enrolment method course metalink and select the corresponding courses. Unfortunately, this doesn't mean the resource is embedded in those courses. You would need to add a link to that course or add some kind of information about it. to create an H5P resource and add it to all the courses. This would need some time in the beginning, but it looks nicer and every update that you make in the original H5P activity will revert to all the places where the H5P activity is added. Just remember to select the option "Create an alias/shortcut to the file" when you add the H5P activity to the courses.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Marie, I have had this question a few times with other clients, but just on a larger scale as they had product training that sometimes fall part of other training courses, so creating the content twice is an admin headache and updating it is even worse. Our solution was to make use of the plugin called "Sub Courses". The idea of this plugin is that you can create multiple courses and re-use them as activities in any number of other courses. My suggestion is then to simply create a "single activity" course format and then re-use it with sub courses as many times as you want.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Beatriz, I am making use of meatlink but as you point out it does not include course activity. I also looked at H5P and this is also a good option except for the one tiny problem - I do not think I can embed HTML into any of the H5P options. One of the key things we want to share from a 'master' is an html form. I will continue to investigate though. Many thanks for your thoughts.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Giovanni - thank you. I will look at this plug in with hope! Keeping the content updated between all instances of its use is an admin nightmare. With best wishes Marie

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: It is a pleasure and I hope it helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Marie, For the specific use you mention, a label, you can do what you want with a template in the Generico filter. You create the filter template with all the info you want in it. Then you can go to any course and add a label. In the label, you add your new Generico template. When you save the label, it will show the info you placed in the template. Repeat the process in all the other courses. If you go update the info in the template, it will automatically show the updated info in all the locations where you have used it. Then of course, you will also have the added benefit of all the other things you can do with the Generico filter.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Giovanni, this is a super practical plugin. Actually, this is what understand when I think of the concept "meta course" .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Always a pleasure to be of assistance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create Master Activity - available to many courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Al, Thank you for this suggestion. It has taken me a while to get me head around the Generico filter but now I am starting to explore it I can see this will be very useful. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple select features
ResponsesInList.Text: One of my biggest frustrations with Moodle is the lack of multiple selection possibilities. Some examples: - I cannot select multiple activities to move them to another place in the course. Sometimes we need to switch the order in which topics within a section are taught, and then we need to move around several activities pertaining to the same subject/topic (e.g. a document + an exercise + a quiz) - I cannot select multiple activities within a section to set them all together to "invisible" / "visible. I need to do this one by one .... - I cannot select multiple filters when grading an assignment. I want to be able to see the submissions for multiple (but not all) groups. And groupings do not appear in the drop down list to filter the submitted assignments - I cannot select multiple filters when dealing with the participants list. I want a list of all students that do not yet belong to a group AND have the status active. It simply is not possible to filter out that list. - I cannot select multiple groups or roles or activities in the reporting function of Moodle. And my list goes on ... If I had a penny for every time a multiple select would have saved me time in managing my courses, I would be rich ... It would improve usability so much if multiple select were possible in all cases (and more) mentioned above.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple select features
ResponsesInList.Text: Some years ago we used https://moodle.org/plugins/block_massaction Unfortunately it seems abandoned but you might search for some working forks ( https://github.com/Syxton/moodle-block_massaction/releases ) Haven't tested any however

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple select features
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Hugo, Thank you for the tip. However, I am not a Moodle admin, and our school is very strict when selecting plugins. Also, this suggested plugin only handles indentation, deletion, hiding, showing, and moving of multiple activities. It does not address selecting multiple filter criteria. Something as usefull as multiple select should be in the core of Moodle. Available without plugins IMHO . Hopefully, by making suggestions here, they get picked up by the awesome team behind Moodle. Because I really like Moodle. It is by far the best LMS available. But when working with it daily, you sometimes get the feeling of it being the worst LMS, with the exception of all others

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle As Graphic Novel
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi--I'm trying to create an upload area for students to respond to each other, and to course content, using avatars. I'd like for them to be able to arrange their entries on the page in a way that looks more like a graphic novel--that gives them more freedom to arrange their own content in relation to other content on the page. What is the best way to achieve this in Moodle? Here's a screen shot of the look I'm trying to design into student control.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle As Graphic Novel
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Will, I can't think of a Moodle tool or plugin that would support this but I did find a free tool called Storynator that is a simple HTML 5 app that allows something like what you want . The students would have to create the images then upload them but other than that it seems like it might work. It supports d rag and drop image placement into the storyboard as well as r e-arranging the order of the images. Here how I added it into a Moodle course Download the storynator-master.zip  from the Github site Uploaded to a folder under the public_html folder on my web server then unzipped it. In Moodle created a course and added the External tool activity to it using the URL for the story.html file e.g. https://mywebserver.com/storynator/story.html Save and display and voila, the Storynator app inside Moodle. I haven't tested it extensively but it might work for you. cheers, Derek

ResponsesInList.Title: return function - sending messages to selected users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello. I work as a professor and I use our university`s Moodle website to send messages (invitations for distance learning classes) to students. The groups of students are not specified by our moderators as soon as groups are changing every 3-5 months, so each student just marks his group in the profile and I have to use the search function to find groups .  Before, I could send messages to users that were found in search section. After an update, this function disappeared as well as other searching features. So, now I have to write to each student separately which makes sending invitations much longer and, I suppose, increases the load on server . Could you, please, return the 'sending to selected students' function? Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: return function - sending messages to selected users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Your Moodle site is badly designed. You need to "group" people somehow. There are many approaches: - make a course per group and enrol the group in the course - make a course per class, enrol them and build groups within the course - group them sitewide, called cohorts - etc The administration need not to group every student. There are ways to get the students to enrol/group themselves - some need additional plug-ins like Group choice . Univ. students are mature enough for some "self organization".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: return function - sending messages to selected users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Visvanath Ratnaweera, thank you. In my message I wrote that groups are changing constantly so it would be problematic to regroup them each time. Thus, it would be much better if searching functionality, namely sending a message to selected found users, would be returned back in further versions of Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: return function - sending messages to selected users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: return function - sending messages to selected users

ResponsesInList.Title: Group Enrollment Keys and Bespoke Landing Pages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I am trying to set up a system that will allow me to: Enroll groups with their own unique enrollment key Automatically send group users to their own branded landing page, based on their group enrollment profile. I have seen how group enrollment keys might work, but cannot find anything current on how to auto-redirect individuals to their group page, based on their profile. There seemed to be  "Profile Redirect" option once, but that seems to have disappeared. Any suggestions as to how I could set this up please? Many thanks Greg

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Enrollment Keys and Bespoke Landing Pages
ResponsesInList.Text: You could consider using the Generico filter on the Front page text area as a means of achieving this. It allows you present different content to different users based on information stored in their profile, either the standard fields (institution, department, etc.) or custom profile fields. It might also allow you redirect to another page automatically using JavaScript . See https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=324771#p1584679 for example. Generico in your case would require HTML + CSS + JavaScript + SQL , so its a bit tricky to set up.

I'll look in to your suggestion . . . . .although I was hoping to avoid "a bit tricky to set up", since I find most of the "standard" things in Moodle a bit tricky! Whatever happened to the "profile Redirect" option? I found a great set of instructions on how to do it in Moodle 2.0, but the options seem to have disappeared from Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bookmarking on the Course Section page
ResponsesInList.Text: Juanita, You can use an internal HTML anchor to do this. Put the anchor in the subsection label and then for the button add an internal href link to the anchor. For more: https://clearlydecoded.com/creating-internal-external-html-links

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatically underline links in text editor
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear moodle community, Does anybody have an idea how I can set up linked text to be automatically underlined when added by a user via the text editor (also without mouse over on the course page)? This is in the meantime an Accesibility regulation in Germany and I can't seem to find a fast way to make this happen automatically. The content "Link zum Google" is linked and it only shows it's one when I go with the mouse over it. I want to achieve the second one "Linked content" to be underlined even without going with the mouse over. Thank you in advance for your help! Kind regards Tina

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatically underline links in text editor
ResponsesInList.Text: Depending on the theme you are using, you can add some custom CSS . For all links to be underlined, use: a {text-decoration:underline} For only links in labels to be underlined, use: .label_content a {text-decoration:underline}

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatically underline links in text editor
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, you led me towards the right direction 😃 I was trying it out on the Boost Campus theme so .label_content wasn't the correct class. After spending a couple of minutes inspecting the code, I found out it's under .no-overflow . So in case anyone needs this on Boost Campus, please insert: .no-overflow a { text-decoration: underline;} It works, I'm so happy (also with the page activity)! Thanks again! Kind regards Tina

ResponsesInList.Title: Nav drawer "More.." redirect to /Course instead of /my

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Nav drawer "More.." redirect to /Course instead of /my
ResponsesInList.Text: I guess this question was asked (by me) some time ago. The conclusion was that developers chose to point to the Course overview block on /my instead of pointing to /course/index.php. The key idea being that a user would probably find all his/her enrolled courses there anyway. There's not really a way to redirect to that place, short of hacking the core code... and that's not something I'd recommend (for update and upgrade purposes, to say the least).

ResponsesInList.Title: Restrict no of devices access course

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restrict no of devices access course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi By device do you really mean a piece of hardware, like a laptop or a mobile device? It is difficult for a web application to differentiate two browsers running in the same laptop or a browser and a mobile app running in the same mobile device. There are methods of bad faith, like device fingerprinting , but Moodle doesn't do that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ang: Restrict no of devices access course
ResponsesInList.Text: In Plugins > Authentication > Manage Authentication you can set a limit to concurrent logins. I guess that setting it to 1 would work, however i'm not sure if it works with the mobile app aswell.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Save default settings

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: error/xml_parsing_error
ResponsesInList.Text: Change Debugging to Developer level temporarily. That should give more information about what the problem is.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ang: How to embed youtube video with start and end time
ResponsesInList.Text: The auto-embed of YouTube videos only works with the regular links and not the embed links. The simplest solution would be to turn the auto-embed off at Site Administration -> Plugins -> Media players -> Manage media players, and turn it off in VideoJS aswell at Site Administration -> Plugins -> Media players -> VideoJS player. Then you can use the embed codes from Youtube, and change the height and width properties to your liking.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link to a topic
ResponsesInList.Text: Interesting question. I am not the expert on this, but I will provide a few thoughts. Some of this might depend upon your theme, but in general, Moodle shows all topics on one web page (with the Boost theme.) So topics do not have their own (HTML) anchors. They are already all showing. So the user is expected to simply scroll down to whichever topic they want to view. You might notice that if you click on a link within a topic, such as a quiz, that in Moodle's breadcrumbs you see the topic, but it is not a hyperlink. This is because clicking on the Course's hyperlink gets you to all topics. Having said this, maybe someone else will know about some other solution.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link to a topic
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Andrew, There is a setting 'Always link course sections ' linkcoursesections in Site admin / Appearance / Navigation which, if enabled, results in topic section links e.g. https://moodle.org/course/view.php?id=5#section-2

ResponsesInList.Title: Improve usability on notifications preferences
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all! I've created an issue to work on having a better notifications preferences interface. IMO the current interface is difficult to understand and also it has too much switches. That's why I opened the issue MDL-67508 . I will try to explain here the improvement again. Notification center Right now we have some notifications plug-ins, including: Web, Mobile, e-mail, Jabber (that IMO, can be removed from core), and 3rd party. The web plugin implies "receiving" the notifications in the bell drawer and also the notifications tab on the Moodle App. With my improvement we could remove the web plugin and make a greater hierarchy to enable disable notification per type. This is, if I enable "Assignment submission" notification I can then configure if I want to receive it by e-mail or mobile (or 3rd party). But it will also imply to always receive it on t he notification drawer on mobile and web. If I disable it then no notification of this category is receive it. This converts the notification drawer into a notification history / center. So all notifications are received there and then on other places. But you have all the notifications in one place at least. Disable by plugin Enable/disable by plug-in. If enabled, you can configure notification by notification of the plugin, if disabled the user will know that they would not receive any notification via this plugin (ie. e-mail). Remove Online/Offline Right now, If I'm not wrong, the system calculates that the user is online or offline like in the "Online users block". So it checks if an action is done in the last 5 minutes (admin can configure time). Having those settings the user has too many switches and it's difficult to understand. If the user goes away and don't close the session, the notifications send on the next 5 minutes can be lost if the user only receive them when Offline. I suggest to remove that or, at least have a 3 state option On/Offline only/Off. But I think it's better On/Off and that's it. With this improvement: Issues about lost notifications can be reduced. All notifications are in one place. It's easier to change and understand what's going on. Mobile will display the notifications even if disabled on Mobile. (also the name of the plug-in has an issue). This is a mock-up on how it could look like. Facebook works that way, this is the screenshot of an example of one notification category called Events. The "Allow Notifications on Facebook" is that greater hierarchy I was talking of, if disabled, nothing bellow is shown. I want to know what do you think and get your vote/comments on the issue. Thank you for your time!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Improve usability on notifications preferences
ResponsesInList.Text: I agree that the current User Interface is not great, and I probably deserve at least some of the blame for the way it is now, so I think it is really great that you are trying to make it better. Thank you very much. And, I don't really want to comment in detail on your proposal (though from a quick look, there is lots to like about it). I just want to make sure you are aware of one important requirement (well, important for the Open University) that it would be good if you did not break. At the OU, we have a custom message plugin, which sends messages through the University's custom messaging system. This ultimately sends an email to the student, but it also puts a copy of the message on the student's portal page, and support staff can check that. The point is to eliminate the excuse 'you never told me that' from students. We can prove that we sent them a message, and they had a chance to see it. So, for 'important' messages, we want to ensure that they are sent through that plugin, and that they can't be turned off. But we also don't want students to be able to select that plugin for any other messages. That is why, in addition to the individual user's perference page, where they can set their persona preferences, there is also an admin settings page at Admin -> Messaging -> Notification settings. (Yes, this UI also sucks, in part because it has to match the UI of the user preferences page, but at least only admins suffer because of this one.) So, anyway, whatever solution you finally come up with, please consider this requirement. I think that becuase the two pages are related, it is natural to consider them together.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Improve usability on notifications preferences
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tim! Thanks Tim for your response!! Including your considerations into the improvement we should take care that the forced settings from the admin settings page (The ones with "Disallowed" modifications, are more important than enabling on/off any of the notifications type, so they have to be "On" rather the user choices. For me it makes totally sense. It's also good to know that it's not only me that sees the "You've never told me that" issue. I'll fight for that to become true! Have a nice weekend!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Improve usability on notifications preferences
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Pau Ferrer Ocaña , Any updates on this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Improve usability on notifications preferences
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ric! Thanks for asking I hope this starts a new conversation and some improvements come to the core soon. This suggestion is that admins be allowed to specify a course page for this, instead of being limited to just the Dashboard or Site Home options. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rick, Thanks for the reply. I've added the attached diagrams to the tracker item. I hope these might help to explain the idea. The user would log in and then be taken to the custom page selected by the admin rather than Site Home or Dashboard. Cheers, Andrew https://moodle.org/pluginfile.php/2069566/mod_forum/post/1657219/MDL-69750-1%28PageFlow%29.jpg https://moodle.org/pluginfile.php/2069566/mod_forum/post/1657219/MDL-69750-2%28Field1%29.jpg https://moodle.org/pluginfile.php/2069566/mod_forum/post/1657219/MDL-69750-3%28Field2%29.jpg

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Okay, I see your desire. So, what happens if a student is in more than one course? Or at your school, is a person only allowed to be in one course?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rick, Most of our students are enrolled in more than one course. The desire to divert users to a customised start page is motivated by at least two main factors: 1. the lack of flexibility of the Dashboard / Site Home The more I think about it, the more surprised I am that it's currently not possible to land on a standard course page as a front page. This is the first page users encounter - especially new users - so it should be able to be customised extensively so it's welcoming, informative and a useful jumping off point to the content they need. Standard course pages provide just this capability - in contrast to the Dashboard or Site Home. For example, for the Dashboard and Site Home, without resorting to extra css or adapting code... a. some blocks can only be set to the right column and there is no built-in support for setting  columns or font size; not all blocks can be set to the centre area b. blocks available on the Dashboard or Site Home are not universally available on other pages; if they are, they can't always be placed in the centre area (; so for a block showing enrolled pages for a long term user, this ends up being a block that runs down the right margin past any existing centre content) c. if we want a list of enrolled pages that is condensed to just the links and in a small font, this is only available in user's menu > profile > course details The equivalent to this user menu list on the Site Home or Dashboard is the Course Overview. This uses space by displaying info we don't need: in the old Course Overview this was tiles; in the newer version, using the List option, this is category and completion level. 2. the variety of our user groups Our site is used as both a LMS and a staff intranet. Feedback from our users included the complaint that it wasn't clear once they'd logged in where to go to access the info they needed, and that there was info shown that wasn't relevant to them. For new users, this problem is worsened by unfamiliarity with the interface. Options available in the Dashboard or Site Home don't allow easy customising of content for these user groups: t ailoring access to individual items of content is possible by role in Site Home and Dashboard. So to use this option we'd need to create a role for each user group that would only be used on either of these two pages, and then assign each new user to one of these roles in the system context . We have around 75 user groups for 2020, not accounting for students who are in second or third years of study. Users can belong to more than one group at a time. Also, some of our students are enrolled in courses that last only a few days. So they don't have as much opportunity to get used to finding what they need. These students can be pretty much any age. Thanks, Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Let me take a slightly different approach. Since your students might be in more than one course, wouldn't it be better to show students the available courses, let them pick their course of interest, have them log in if they are not yet logged in, and then take them right to the course that they picked? There is no right or wrong logic. I am just presenting an idea to you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Interesting idea! You're right - that is a different approach to the situation! A great option for when you know exactly where you want to go. With this front page change, I guess I'm thinking more on the lines of a hub page though. This could provide an initial landing point with current news, guidance for new users in where to find particular content, and a jumping off point to multiple pages. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: I am not being a wiz at any of this, just offering an idea. Take a look at my Moodle frontpage . Courses are presented. My students pick their course of interest, then log in, then are taken right to the course that they picked. Maybe your students come to your Moodle saying "I have no clue which course I am going to work in, I wish the Moodle admin would decide for me."  But don't most students know what they want to study? Anyway, my Frontpage is just an example of a number of ways that Moodle shows its frontpage.  I am not doing anything special.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: Andrew, I think this is a valuable idea. There are some types of sites where you want to have a single, central place for users to land, a place over which you have a lot of control. Right now, the only object that could do this is a course. In business sites, having a single course into which all users are enrolled which serves as a general 'hub" or "commons" like course for all users is pretty common. I've built any number of sites like that, and the usual solution to this is to have a link on the real front page that users click to go to the hub course. Being able to automatically redirect would be very useful in such cases. (I usually add one of the auto-enrol plugins to help with this.) +1 and voted up. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home

So if they want to go from the page they select off your front page to another, would they go back to the front page? As I noticed that you only have Home in your nav bar, and no courses listed in your top menu. 2. Do you have much experience with multiple languages in the one Moodle instance? Also noticed this selection in your top menu. Cheers, A

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: 1) My students would know which "course" they want to go to, yes. If a student happens to be in more than one course, they would see their other courses in the NavDrawer. Those other courses are one mouse-click away and would not even require a login. (Maybe two clicks away if the student chose to compress the NavDrawer.) Yes, you notice only a Home in my NavDraw because you are not logged in, nor are you enrolled in any courses. 2) Yes, I provide the multiple languages menu in my top Nav Bar. I haven't tracked how many students switch languages. However, I do think that some Chinese students like to make the switch, so it does happen. These multiple languages are built into Moodle, so it doesn't take much work to do what I did.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Front page - allow selection of pages other than Dashboard or Site Home
ResponsesInList.Text: If you want all users to be in a common course, you have to get them enrolled somehow. One easy way to do this is to use one of the Auto-enrol plugins so that the user is automatically enrolled in the course when the click into the link to the course. No extra admin work or pre-enrollment needed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Simplified File Picker?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Apologies if this issue has been addressed before, but is there any way to simplify the file picker processes? There are so many clicks to get to the point of actually uploading a file from the host device. (I'm voicing some concerns from some customers who have lower tech abilities).

Here is how it works from my perspective:
click "Choose file"-->(popup)-->click " upload a file" repository-->click "browse"-->window opens on host device i.e. my computer.

find the file and click it. then click "open" to actually choose it (depending on the type of PC)

then

pause while wondering about the "Save as" textbox -- do I need it? And the author? And the license?

before clicking "Upload this file."

Am I done? Not quite.

The file is there but not saved until I click "save" or "upload" or whichever activity I'm trying to add a file to.

Note: The drag/drop file upload is one motion one-click -- awesome!

If we could have the option of disabling the file picker and just go straight from "Choose a file" to the PC dialog window, that might be easier for new Moodle users.

Just curious about thoughts people have on the possibility for a user to disable the file picker experience and just go with a more "simple" upload style.

Would this make Moodle a bit more usable?

ResponsesInList.Title: IMO: "Announcements" could be improved
ResponsesInList.Text: Announcements can be edited, or deleted, like an activity, but cannot be added like an activity. Why not? This seems inconsistent with the way everything else in the course is done. Why can't the teacher delete individual announcements, whenever the teacher wants to do so? Maybe the teacher realizes, the next day, that an announcement was made in error. Why must you delete the entire thing, to delete one message? According to the Moodle, Announcements can be restored by setting the number of announcement to non-zero. In my experience: this does not seem to work. Why is the maximum number of Announcements set to ten? Is this way to convey, possible critical, information, prominent enough? I suspect a lot of people will just ignore the Announcement sections . If you have an announcement like: "The site will be going down in 20 minutes." Shouldn't that be more like a billboard across the top the course, instead of some dropdown list?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Closed Captions to Tutorial Videos.  Captions Disappear When I upload into Moodle.
ResponsesInList.Text: In Camtasia, export the captions as SRT files. Then you will need to add them to Moodle's video player. I assume that you are uploading your videos into Moodle as MP4 files.

ResponsesInList.Title: Is there a way to either duplicate or upload a category/sub-categories tree structure?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. The above header refers. I am new to moodle but I have been enjoying the experience of installing and configuring my moodle site thus far. It has been fascinating: so many plugins and stuff to add to my production site. However, due to the peculiar nature of my installation (where I am hopeful of setting up multiple course categories that would have similar courses), I am finding it very stressful to be "manually" re-creating the sub-categories tree structure for every new category that I am setting up (before I use the upload courses with the template_courses feature to copy the associated courses) and it is not funny at all, when the no of categories in question is already easily numbering over 250. So, I stumbled upon a solution that apparently worked in a previous version of moodle, but it is not working in moodle 3.83+ (uploadcoursecategory-compat-moodle3.x.zip by Piers Harding that is supposed to be compatible with Moodle 3.x). When I try to upload this file (Upload_Categories.txt), it gives this error (the screenshot below): So, can someone pls help me to check out this plugin and make the necessary corrections to get it working with moodle 3.83+. It is going to be a real life saver. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is there a way to either duplicate or upload a category/sub-categories tree structure?
ResponsesInList.Text:
The error message is telling you that the field name is invalid - because it has a space in front of it. The field name is "description" not " description" so " description" is not a valid field. You should check the format of your upload file to remove any white space from the field names (and from data rows too if needed). it should look like this: 
```text
name,description,idnumber,visible
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is there a way to either duplicate or upload a category/sub-categories tree structure?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. I tried uploading a sample .csv file based on your recommendation. It has now stopped complaining of the field names. ResponsesInList.Title: Top 3 Usability Issues in a High school using Moodle

Teachers dont know where the Turn Editing Button is and the Action Menu has too many options. Asked this question by every new user and on multiple occasions. 2. Teachers want to be able to drag Resources and Activities into a Folder. (In other words, they would like a subpage, only the subpage plugin does not work.) I am asked this question on a weekly basis!! 3. Teachers want to be able to add Sections to Courses running in Single Section per page mode. An example of this is the Grid Format. I have noted that the new Multi-topic format accomplishes this and is very good, but so many of my teachers enjoy the look of the Grid Format, it will be difficult changing them to a format that looks entirely different.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Top 3 Usability Issues in a High school using Moodle

It also modifies the options. 2) There might already be a feature request for your "folder" idea. If not, create one in the Moodle Tracker system. 3) I don't use my Moodle this way. This could be a custom Theme need. You might want to mention which version of Moodle you are using and your theme.

Not down the bottom of the section. It would also be good to have a simple way for teachers to add a description to the resource ( AJAX ) without having to click Edit.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Top 3 Usability Issues in a High school using Moodle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Top 3 Usability Issues in a High school using Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Yep, I voted for this one.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Top 3 Usability Issues in a High school using Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Actually I hate how the Action Menu has different options on different pages. e.g. the Course Page, the Page Page, the Quiz Page and the Participants Page. The Icon becomes confusing because you expect the same functionality. It breaks the Usability Principle of Consistency. I think there needs to be more differentiation between each of the page types, so you know you are on a different page and the action menu is different for each of the pages. with perhaps some text: Page Settings, Enrolment Settings etc

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Top 3 Usability Issues in a High school using Moodle

I mean, you don't have the same controls on your bicycle and your car, and it would not be more usable if you did.

ResponsesInList.Title: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: I am trying to manage a hundred+ learning plan templates. Frequently I need to add a single competency to all of the current Learning Plans or a large collection of Learning Plans. This takes hours to do manually, one-by-one. Within Competency Frameworks, I can view linked courses, but I cannot link a competency to a Learning Plan. This menu option would be so much better, if the functionality to link a competency to a learning plan option was created. That option would bring up a list of all visible learning plan templates. The user could select one or all of the learning plans templates. The save option would link all selected learning plans to the competency.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: That would be a great improvement. My other pet peeve is when editing the framework, if you scroll down more than one screen, the detail box with the competency information does not come with you. You have to find the competency many screens down, then scroll back up to the top to see any information about it. This is just bad basic web page design for any page. Much of competency interface system seems to come from a world where only a couple of dozen competencies and students exist. While in this world, formal competency standards for most organizations in most countries run into thousands of competencies, and there are hundreds of learning plans for thousands or tens of thousands of students.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: As you summarized so concisely most organizations run into thousands of competencies….and hundreds of learning plans... I agree, this part of the UI needs remodeling. I have been searching the open tickets to see if someone has already submitted a similar request.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah, if you find such a ticket, let me know and I will upvote it and see if I can find someone to take a look at fixing it ;) From an architecture point of view, Moodle has a number of systems where bulk processes are assumed to be taken care of by external systems, like authentication, enrollments, etc. That was a sensible starting point twenty years ago when your customers are schools with existing SIS systems. Then over time, some bulk tools were added internally for those without such external SIS systems (like small schools, not-for-profits, organizations, businesses.) Standard competency sets are large and have always been large. So, it is has been a bit of a mystery why this was not a base requirement of the feature set from the start for competencies to have tools for managing large numbers of items in the UI. The LMS is the logical place to do this, too.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: Please vote for this tracker issue if you are managing large groups of competencies and learning plans - MDL-69237

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link a Competency to multiple Learning Plan Templates
ResponsesInList.Text: Done! Thanks for creating that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Certification course (copy by reference)
ResponsesInList.Text: I've been away from Moodle for awhile, so I'm really behind on what the capabilities are. I'm looking for a feature that I don't know what it's called here, or if it even exists. Here's the scenario. I have a catalog of courses that each be taken standalone at-will. We'll call them A,B, C, ... Z. I'll be creating a certification course that requires completing A, C, D, N, and X. Then there will another certification course that uses A, C, F, P, and X. In the system being used now, I can create the cert course by doing a "copy by reference," whereby the standalone course are "copied" into the cert course (sort of like each required standalone course becomes a lesson in the new course). The learner enrolls in the cert course and is automatically presented all the courses required. In addition, if the learner takes one of the standalone courses that's used in a cert course, and then later enrolls in the cert course, it automatically shows credit received for the standalone course(s) already completed. I track the cert course only, meaning I don't want to have to figure out if learners have taken the individual courses that comprise the cert course. Is this possible in Moodle? If so, what is this feature called (what do I look up to read up on it)?

ResponsesInList.Title: Limit Course Visibility by Profile Field?
ResponsesInList.Text: Our organization provides customized training services to our customers, and I need to restrict visibility based on the customer's organization. Right now, I have a custom profile field OrgID that puts them in a cohort, and then I use cohort sync enrolment. This works fine, except the users need to be enrolled in all the available courses in order to see them. I'd prefer to a second tier of visibility. For example, users from Company B should never see courses built for Company A. But each Company A user should be able to see all the courses we created for them, while only being actively enrolled in a few. All suggestions appreciated!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Limit Course Visibility by Profile Field?
ResponsesInList.Text: Got it working, but interested in feedback on better approaches. Here's what I did... 1. Define a new System role "Company A" using Authenticated User as archetype 2. Use the Cohort Role Sync plugin to get all Company A users assigned to this role (they're already in a Company A cohort) 3. Stick all the courses that are for Company A into a dedicated Category 4. In the Company A Category, add 2 permissions for the Company A User role - category:viewcourselist - course:view The users see their enrolled courses in My Courses, and they're not overwhelmed by every course they could ever use. If they want to see what else is available, they can use the "All Courses..." button on the Filtered Course List block on the dashboard .

ResponsesInList.Title: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Is there a way that a teacher can manually unlock an activity for a student. Or if someone has any other suggestion to achieve the following. The teacher does a video call pre-assessment with a student with the Big Blue Button. Only after the activity is complete does the must the student be able to do the quiz. However there is no way to prevent the Student from marking the BBB activity as complete and starting the quiz. I need the quiz to be locked until the Teacher unlocks it. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Deon, There are multiple ways to do this, just be creative. One possibility for all students at one time, set the quiz to Open at some future date, then remove the Open date when you are ready for the students to take the quiz. Another for all students at one time, use a quiz password and don't give it out until time to take the quiz. One possibility that will work for one student at a time. Set the Group mode for the quiz to separate groups, then add each student as you want them to be able to take the test. You can also add a Restriction requiring students to be in a certain group and then add each student as you want them to be able to take the test. There are other restrictions that could also be used.

ResponsesInList.Title: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Consider setting a password for the quiz, then you only need to send the password to the student in your BBB session, then they can unlock the quiz their-self.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for your reply. I am gonna set a  password. More appropriate to my needs. Kind Reagrds

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher Unlock Activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Great, thank you very much. That will work. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Collection of flagged questions
ResponsesInList.Text: They show up in the quiz reports, but you would still have to visually scan down all the rows of the report. Or, you could do it with https://moodle.org/plugins/report_customsql , and a query like: SELECT q.name, COUNT(1) AS Number_of_attemps, SUM(WHEN qa.flagged = 0 THEN 0 ELSE 1 END) AS Number_flagged FROM mdl_quiz_attempts quiza JOIN mdl_question_usages qu ON qu.id = quiza.uniqueid JOIN mdl_question_attempts qa ON qa.questionusageid = qu.id JOIN mdl_question q

ResponsesInList.Title: Grades overview report - issue with parents viewing student grades
ResponsesInList.Text: I have Moodle set up so that a parent can view the progress of their student(s).  In the Reports section, when I click on a particular course in the student's list, I see all of his grades for that course.  But, if I want to go back to the list of courses the student is enrolled in to pick another course, I cannot click on the "Overview report" link below the student's name: because it links to my grades, not the student's.  If I want to pick another course, I have to click the Back button in my browser and select another course from the list that way. I have also noticed that when i first go into the Grades overview report for a student, the "User report" link below the student's name also has this problem of taking me to my grades and not the student's. The "Sitewide User report" link does this also. Is this a bug in the links?

ResponsesInList.Title: Assignments with different dates
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings! I would like to know if it is possible to have an assignment or  tasks, where the student can set the day it was done, but is  not  necessarily the completion date.  Like,  I have an assignment, but I can chose what date it is effective or can be counted for. Any toughs? Thanks in advance. J.G.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assignments with different dates
ResponsesInList.Text: A Moodle "assignment" is typically where you want a student to upload a file. Is this what you mean?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assignments with different dates
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Rick, Thank you for your reply. I am sorry I was not clear enough. Yes, the assignments is where we want a student to upload a file. But what I meant is, if I am going to upload an assignment that was finished a different day than the submission date...can that be accomplished? For instance, I have an assignment, where I must load a certificate of completion of an instructor led training taken outside the organisation. (My moodle website is not published to the internet.) Therefore, I may be taking and finishing that course possibly prior the date it will be marked as completed in my moodle site, if I upload the certificate a few days later after I return from my outside training. I am looking for ways to have that submission marked in the system as completed the day I took the training (it can be a few days earlier), not the day I submit the certificate in the assignment. Thanks in advance J.G.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assignments with different dates
ResponsesInList.Text: A Moodle "Assignment" supports several dates (see picture.)  You do not need to put a date into all.  In my example, I want students to be able to submit as early as I turn this assignment on, so I do not enable the "Allow submissions from" switch. Do you have a MoodleCloud account?  If not, get one and then practice with these settings.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assignments with different dates
ResponsesInList.Text: Assignment (and quiz) also support user and group overrides where you can set different dates per user or group

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assignments with different dates
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Rick! I am sorry for the delay replying. I believe the Assignment Availability may not be the solution. I don't think what I need is even possible for moodle. For instance, LEts imagine this scenario: Often, my students take training at outside entities, then they upload their completion certificates as an assignment into my website as soon as they have return. For instance, lets say my students may be taking an instructor led CPR training this week, in an outside classroom and they are awarded the certificate of completion today.. but, they can only load the certificate of completion on my moodle website when back tomorrow. The assignment, will mark the submission date as Tomorrow, when technically, they completed training today. Perhaps a pluggin can do this? Thank you very much, and I am sorry for the hassles.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assignments with different dates
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks John! But what I am looking to accomplish is to let the students to set even prior dates when they submit their assignments. Can they override (change the submission date to the past) if I give them permissions?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assignments with different dates
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, but how would you want any system to know when a student actually does something? Moodle can only know when an assignment is uploaded. Moodle is not a mind-reader? But you do have at least some alternatives that I can quickly think about: 1) You can look at each certificate and manually note the date on it. 2) You can ask the student "when did you finish your training?" (This can be done in a number of ways.) 3) You might be able to export the dates from the "other" system and import them into Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Session time-out warning dialogue - could be better
ResponsesInList.Text: I keep seeing this recently, because I will be doing some development, and then leave my test Moodle open in a browser tab. Always, when I come back later, there is the popup open telling me that my session is about to expire. Obviously, by then, when I click Extend session, I then get then error telling me that my session has expired. This is silly and annoying. Clearly, how it should work is: When you get to the warning time, then the pop-up appears at present. And, if you click Extend session before it fully expires, then that also works like it does now. However (and this is the new bit) if you actually get to the time when the session expires, then the contents of the dialogue should automatically change to say that your session has expired. That could give two options, 'Log in again', or, if you have unsaved data on the current page (which, since we have form-change-checker, we can know with some convidence) there should be a 'Close dialogue' button, so you can copy-and-paste any data you want to save before you log in. Has anyone already made a tracker issue for this? If not, I will.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Session time-out warning dialogue - could be better
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah! there is alreay a tracker issue: MDL-65856 . If you agree with this, please vote.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scrolling in Reports
ResponsesInList.Text: I'd like to make the suggestion that you make scrolling in reports a little more user friendly.  I use the Course Completion and Activity Completion reports and have many people taking courses. There are also many types of activities they need to complete. It would be helpful if the names of students locked in place on the left when scrolling across the activities, and if the scroll bar at the bottom was set so that you didn't have to go all the way to the bottom of the page to scroll to the right. The problem I have is trying to track who is actually doing what without printing the report on an Excel spreadsheet.  Many times I've had to count down the lines to determine where the student is on the report, and then go to the bottom of the report to scroll across to see what they still need to complete.  When I reach the far right I then have to count down the rows to assure I've got the right person. It's somewhat easier if I pull out a small number of student, for example last name beginning with "A", but if the name begins with "S" it becomes a lot harder as there are so many of them. Just a suggestion - thank you for all the work you do, and the many improvements you've already made. Melanie

ResponsesInList.Title: Scrolling in Reports
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a good suggestion. I've created an improvement tracker MDL-68587 for anyone who has suggestions on how to get this "Grader Report" functionality into the Activity Completion report. [Edited -- added Grader Report]
